title: Approach
text: Since the problem wants the answer in grams, we will convert all measurements into grams before proceeding with arithmetics.

title: Relation between kg and g
text: The relation between grams and kilograms is $$1000$$ $$g=1$$ kg.

title: Converting the Weight of Duck
text: We start by converting the weight of the duck into grams. What is $$1.2$$ kg in g?

title: Applying the Conversion
text: To convert $$1.2$$ kg into g, we use the expression $$1.2$$ $$kg=(1.2$$ kg)*(1000 g)/(1 kg)=(1.2)*(1000 g)/(1)=1200 g. The first equality holds because $$1000$$ $$g=1$$ kg, and the second equation holds because we can cancel the kg.

title: Final Answer
text: Now that we have both the dove's weight and the duck's weight in grams, to find the difference between their weights, we can simply subtract the the two numbers.
